fields.Name: Pitch Day
fields.Some notes:
**`Pitch day - 20/06/2025`**
Very emotional week — feeling both demotivated at times and highly motivated at others. She’s starting to change her mindset, trying to be more open to new ideas, perspectives, and support.

Wants to find the right person to work with — has already spoken to a few people and is thinking about mutual expectations.

Still wants to take more time to get to know people better.

Came in with an idea but is becoming more open to other possibilities.

Next week: Still wants to explore further.

Build community

What is the moat or uniqueness? (differentiation)

fields.Name: Pitch Day
fields.Some notes:
Dominka: 
\- In the whole deck I wasn't sure who is the client vs user
\- Would love to understand where does the business model and pricing come from, and if a roadmap could be created
\- Need to understand what it would take the team to get the governmental data - data plays are notoriously hard and with extremely long delivery timelines, especially on the governmental levels
\- Scalability: How easily can this be replicated in other countries - understand that the team have a network in Germany which would make approaching governments easier - but what about other countries?

Niklas: 
- increase early signals
- question if that can be global or only country specific

fields.Name: Pitch Day
fields.Some notes:
Dominika:
\- Not much feedback, as from the presentation I didn’t understand the product at all
\- Seem to be super early, missing commercials that could hopefully make us understand it more

fields.Name: Pitch Day
fields.Some notes:
**`Pitch day - 20/06/2025`**
Problem: A lot of misunderstandings in influencer marketing. Yet today, it offers some of the best returns on investment. It’s becoming mainstream, but the industry still lacks structure.
(The problem is already clearly defined.)

Solution: Full automation for the category – score and identify the perfect influencers. Campaigns can be created for clients in under a minute, from processing to delivery.

Next week: Focus on sales. Onboard a new team member to support with AI and management. Three meetings already planned.

fields.Name: Pitch Day
fields.Some notes:
Dominika:
\- Targeting French market - wasn't sure if it was just French market, and if yes, then is there a specific reason why French? Is it just because we're in France, or is there a viable business reasoning?
\- "20-50k pain" mentioned in the problem statement - what are the numbers representing and where are they coming from
\- HR tech is such a red ocean - the team needs to focus on what is the unique differentiator
\- Potentially look into competition not mentioned in the deck - Manatal, GoHire, Ashby, Workable.

fields.Name: Pitch day
fields.Some notes:
**`Pitch day - 20/06/2025`**
Still working on the humanoid simulation market. Exploring how to repurpose existing components of humanoid robots and find valuable use cases. Most of this technology comes from labs and flashy videos — especially in China and the US — while Europe is lagging behind.

He’s passionate about robotics and truly believes in the potential of this booming market. Actively trying to convince others of the opportunity.

Wants to draw inspiration from what’s happening in Europe and China.

Still looking for a CPO or CTO.
Has started identifying suppliers.
Wants to set up one focused work session per week with people who know the ecosystem.
Will be in Munich for an event, and already has a contact who can provide components.

fields.Name: Pitch day
fields.Some notes:
**`Pitch day - 20/06/2025`**
Targeting short-term rental agencies and property owners. Building an AI-powered platform for property management. Right now, it’s mainly focused on guest communication, but the goal is to expand into full property management.

There are over 1 million Airbnb listings in France – they’ve started doing market sizing.

First team is forming.

They’re testing the idea as quickly as possible due to heavy competition – speed is key. Tried calling 25 people from Google: 0 responses. Then tried Facebook and WhatsApp communities: 0% success. Switched to LinkedIn outreach and started getting better responses. Also leveraged their own network.

Next week: they got a contact from Niklas, who’s a co-host and property owner on Airbnb. Expecting several calls.

fields.Name: Pitch Day
fields.Some notes:
AI powered credit scoring app
- Problem: freelancers and gig workers are invisible for banks due to thin credit file —> lack of financial history 

What they did: 
- Manifesto and landing page
    - Built new landing page as people are not familiar with landing page 
- Clean landing page 
    - Click what credit score it to get informed —> understand why they should care about it
- Test what their personal credit score is 
- Test their score and start assessment —> get insights about their financial information 
    - Test out this week
- Calls with 2 VCs

- Voodoo score when banks give low score because they lack data

- Franz: spoke to banks

- Enter in markets with low regulations

What is unique: 
- Alternative data (user provides data —> connect data)

- United Credit is connecting all accounts 

For next week: 
- Talk to users
- Franz: 
    - Test with CEO of an online bank
    - Franz has friend to do credit scoring —> get as advisor

fields.Name: Pitch Day

Dominka: 
\- Data: How would you store the data (inside LLM) and how would you ensure it's not used to train the models 
\- Competitor: ContractPodAI - All-in-one platform with AI triage, review, and workflow automation
\- Want to target big companies - why? Those giants could and would build their own. I'd rather focus on medium enterprises (100-5000 employees) where the pain point is big enough, but the company is small enough not to be able to justify building their own solution

fields.Name: Pitch day

**`Pitch day - 20/06/2025`**
Targeting short-term rental agencies and property owners. Building an AI-powered platform for property management. Right now, it’s mainly focused on guest communication, but the goal is to expand into full property management.

There are over 1 million Airbnb listings in France – they’ve started doing market sizing.

First team is forming.

They’re testing the idea as quickly as possible due to heavy competition – speed is key. Tried calling 25 people from Google: 0 responses. Then tried Facebook and WhatsApp communities: 0% success. Switched to LinkedIn outreach and started getting better responses. Also leveraged their own network.

fields.Name: Pitch Day

fields.Name: Pitch day
fields.Some notes:
- The market is highly fragmented
- 80% of the market is controlled by 3 major players — a “big market” but with a lot of inefficiencies
- **3 main reasons why this matters**:
- 
    1. In just 2 weeks, the team identified significant potential to add value
    2. Most processes are still manual and not digitalised — agencies waste time on manual coding, sending messages, etc.
    3. Compared to fully digital players, traditional actors are inefficient and outdated
- A large portion of the market still relies on manual work
- Lack of transparency — it’s unclear who the best players are
- Signed Letters of Intent (LOIs) with 2 agencies

**Next steps:**

- Identify and map out other key actors to further validate the pain points
- Start building demos and Proofs of Concept (POCs)

fields.Name: Pitch Day
fields.Some notes:

Had a lot of conversations.

Three very good team discussions and connections with three different projects and people. Currently testing out different teams. It’s been hard for him to commit to just one project.

Next week: plans to commit to one and start building.

fields.Name: Pitch Day
fields.Some notes:
Dominka: 
\- Presentation: focus less on the problem (for such a short presentation), practice the presenting itself
\- Alternative financial data mentioned - what data are we talking about and how would it be acquired
\- Extremely small SOM - with those numbers this is probably not a VC scalable business

Niklas:
bad tam sam som
- banks are paying but they are not included: need to include why this is a problem for banks (how to make more revenue), problem statement with SMEs does not make sense anymore

fields.Name: Pitch Day
fields.Some notes:
Dominka: 
\- Pricing: Unclear from the deck. Is it 25eur/listing or per user/month?
\- Look in details into the rules of the partnership programs of [Booking.com](http://booking.com/) and Airbnb - the contracts are easy to sign and obtain the API, but notoriously harsh for the third parties and protecting the giants, while harming the growth of the startups

fields.Name: Pitch Day

They’ve started getting some early users. Began talking to someone from Goldman Sachs in Munich and started pitching to some family offices.

Still looking for a technical cofounder and working on making that decision.

fields.Name: Pitch Day

**`Pitch day - 20/06/2025`**
Problem: Recruitment is a pain — companies receive too many candidates, spend hours reviewing applications, summarizing, conducting interviews, etc.

So far, they have 25 signups.
Next week: Aim to reach 100 signups, sign one design partner, and get people using the extension.

fields.Name: Pitch Day
fields.Some notes:
- several tools —> problem of reconciliation 
- secret sauce not clear 
- end to end —> always an issue, not realistic —> only one pain point 
- why you and why your product is totally unclear

Dominika: 
\- Language of the presentation a little too technical (SLA penalties etc.) - cool to show you know the space, but using too many acronyms can lead to bigconfusion
\- Specific logistics? Use different tools?
\- Competitors: Missing understanding what’s their secret sauce
\- User vs Customer: Who is going to pay for this and **why**
\- Company to look at: Maersk A/S - remember about the approach, don't overshoot with general approach, but rather target niche and specific people in the organization that are responsible for that niche.

fields.Name: Review pitch deay
fields.Some notes:
**`Review pitch deck - 25/06/2025`**


### Team
- 10 years HR experience at Crédit Agricole
- Experienced team of 3-4 full-time members, currently unpaid
- Mix of freelancers and investors
### Solution & Product
- Combines Duolingo and Pokemon Go concepts
- Focus areas:
    - Mental health prevention for employees
    - Climate action (CO2 savings tied to challenges)
- Initially climate-focused, now seeing increased demand for health features
- Daily engagement:
    - 6 daily actions/challenges
    - 3-4 wellness check-in questions
    - 3-week campaign duration with gamification
    - Rewards include prizes or charitable donations
- Carbon calculator integration:
    - Tracks commuting
    - Food waste
    - General waste management
- 30% conversion rate
### Competition
- Alan has launched similar functionality within their application
### Go-to-Market
- White label strategy for existing applications
- Target stakeholders: HR or Innovation departments
- Enterprise focus:
    - Planon and Schneider
    - Crédit Agricole (4k employees, regional branches)
    - Equans (2k employees)
- Sales cycle: 4 months per client
- Entry strategy:
    - Free trial for 20-60 employees
    - Communication kit and onboarding support
    - CODIR presentation for results
    - 1-year subscription contracts
### Business Model
- Per-employee pricing structure:
    - €50 per team
    - Per-campaign pricing option
    - Annual subscription available
- White label solution: €60k annually
### Traction
- Equans: 10k
- Crédit Agricole: 10k
- In discussions with Paris Airport
### Financials
- Funding secured:
    - €30k FPI
    - €40k loan
    - €20k honorary loan
- Currently working with 3 companies
- Runway situation:
    - €70k BSA Air funding secured
    - Can sustain operations for 1 year
    - Seeking €1M equity round
    - Fundraising since March
    - Met with Daphni, Inco
    - Attending Paris&Co events
    - Targeting 18-month runway post-raise
### Strategic Priorities
- Urgent need for recruitment
- Customer feature requests pending
- Fundraising as top priority

fields.Name: Pitch Day

- AI voice agent that will take the calls from the guest

    - Log details:

\- Deck is ALWAYS a good idea - team didn’t have the deck at all
\- How would the team ensure the accuracy rates of the AI responses/calls to the technicians etc.
\- The team is already building the MPV, but doesn't have the deck and lacks basic validation? Would pause the MVP and focus on the latter instead.

fields.Name: Pitch Day
fields.Some notes:
- Rank agencies, conversational AI with the worker (ask workers right away)
- How do you get the data for best matches?

    - Not the agencies - always happy to get clients 

Dominika:
\- Didn't understand who is the end customer (and is it the same as user) - is it Intermediaries or the demand side (hiring companies)?
\- The product seems highly dependent on quality of the data input by intermediaries - how to mitigate risks coming with that?
\- The idea is still very vague and I'm not convinced about the business model at this stage

fields.Name: Pitch Day
fields.Some notes:
